entry.title: US House passes amendment to investigate Azerbaijani war crimes

media:group.media:title: US House passes amendment to investigate Azerbaijani war crimes
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe U.S. House of Representatives passed an amendment to this year‚Äôs defense budget bill that requires a report into Azerbaijani war crimes. üìçPrime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and EU Special Representative Toivo Klaar discussed Armenian cultural heritage in Azerbaijani-controlled Karabakh. üìçMoscow fully supports Armenia-Turkey normalization, said a Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson.

entry.title: What would a Russian victory ‚Äì or defeat ‚Äì in Ukraine mean for Armenia?

media:group.media:title: What would a Russian victory ‚Äì or defeat ‚Äì in Ukraine mean for Armenia?
media:group.media:description:
Anna Ohanyan, a professor of political science and international relations at Stonehill College in Massachusetts, sat down with CivilNet to talk about the impact of Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine on Armenia. Ohanyan discusses what a Russian victory or defeat in Ukraine would look like and mean for the South Caucasus, as well as the Armenia-Turkey normalization process.

entry.title: Corruption allegations after coming to power in Armenia on anti-corruption platform

media:group.media:title: Corruption allegations after coming to power in Armenia on anti-corruption platform
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of #InsightsWithEricHacopian, Eric talks about recent corruption allegations against former Deputy Prime Minister Tigran Avinyan. Eric also discusses a spat that erupted between Canada and Russia over Canada opening an embassy in Yerevan and plans for the construction of a 33-meter tall statue of Jesus Christ on Mount Hatis.

entry.title: Parliament proposes to strip most opposition deputies of mandates

media:group.media:title: Parliament proposes to strip most opposition deputies of mandates
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe conditions for obtaining Armenian citizenship may be tightened. Applicants will be required to spend at least 60 days in the country during a period of two years. üìçThe United States fully supports the normalization process between Armenia and Turkey, the State Department said in a statement. üìçAnd the leadership council of Armenia‚Äôs parliament will convene a special session to discuss depriving certain opposition deputies of their mandates.

entry.title: Closing the gender gap in Armenia‚Äôs burgeoning tech sector

media:group.media:title: Closing the gender gap in Armenia‚Äôs burgeoning tech sector
media:group.media:description:
Seda Papoyan, the managing director of the Armenian chapter of Girls in Tech, a global non-profit seeking to close the gender gap in tech around the world, sat down with CivilNet to talk about the upcoming FemInno conference. The conference, which will take place on July 30-31 in Yerevan, will have over 30 speakers from around the world, as well as master classes and workshops. Papoyan discussed why the participation of women in tech is important, how the FemInno conference seeks to achieve better representation for women in tech, and why companies are realizing that diversity policies improve their chances of success.
